snippet: More than 4 in 10 Pennsylvania residents said the N.C.A.A.’s punishment of Penn State was too severe, a new poll shows.
abstract: Pennsylvanians are divided over the penalties imposed by the NCAA on Penn State's football team for its handling of the Jerry Sandusky sexual abuse scandal, with more than 4 in 10 saying the punishment was too severe, and about a third deeming it appropriate.
lead_paragraph: More than 4 in 10 Pennsylvania residents said the N.C.A.A.’s punishment of Penn State was too severe, a new poll shows.

headline.seo: Pennsylvanians Divided on Penn State Penalties, Poll Shows
headline.main: Pennsylvanians Are Split on Penn State Penalties
headline.print_headline: Pennsylvanians Are Split On Penn State Penalties
